title: Journal of Manufacturing Science and Engineering Open Issues

items.title: Adaptive Knowledge-Informed Error Compensation for Process Planning in Extrusion-Based Additive Manufacturing
A Method for Stability Intent Understanding in Physical Humanâ€“Robot Collaboration for Large-Scale Component Assembly
items.summary:
- Surveys pHRI and collaborative manufacturing, stressing multimodal intention sensing (EMG/EEG/eye tracking/vision/tactile cues) and fusion methods with admittance-based shared control for stability and safety.
- Covers predictive/dynamic role assignment (hierarchical prediction, target forecasting, fuzzy inference), learning from demonstrations, and federated learning for privacy in online intent prediction.
- Notes biomechanical studies (gait, posture, grip, force) and general fusion techniques for robust activity recognition in smart manufacturing.

items.title: In-Line Monitoring of Balling Phenomenon in Directed Energy Deposition Processes
items.summary:
- In-line monitoring of the balling phenomenon in directed energy deposition (DED) processes.
- Real-time detection and characterization approaches for balling during deposition.
- Published in ASME Journal of Manufacturing Science and Engineering (DOI 10.1115/1.4070451); paywalled access.

items.title: A Meta-Learning Based Surface Roughness Prediction During SiCp/Al Composites Machining
items.summary:
- The framework uses surface topography images and a prototypical network to identify surface features and predict roughness with few-shot generalization.
- It couples the prototypical network with empirical Bayesian learning to map features to roughness, treating encoded features as intermediate responses and removing dependence on prior processing settings.
- Validated on milling SiCp/Al composites with optical ultra-depth microscopy, showing feasibility across diverse machining conditions and aiding feature identification.
